definitions: To make minor changes to (a text, piece of legislation, etc.) in order to make it fairer or more accurate, or to improve it.
To make small changes or additions to improve or correct something.
To correct or improve one's own behavior or habits.
examples: The proposal was amended to include all members.
He amended his statement after new evidence emerged.
We need to amend the document before submission.
She resolved to amend her ways and be more punctual.
